intro: Jacquemontia oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxacan golden vine, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, round seeds. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often found in shaded, moist areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
